DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to analyze the effects of a dual task protocol on cognitive domains and functional capacity in non-sedentary older adults. The hypothesis of the present study is that older people undergoing to a dual task exercise protocol have greater benefits on cognition and functional performance, compared to a standard exercise protocol.
DOC.brief_title: Effects of a Dual Task Protocol on Cognition and Functionality in Non-sedentary Older Adults
DOC.criteria: aged over 60 years community people ability to walk alone nonsedentary nonrealization of any cognitive or functional assessment presence of Parkinson's Disease, Dementia and Stroke with motor sequel frequency to trainings below 70%
